ray.rage.scene

Interface SubEntity

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable, Renderable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GenericSubEntity

    public interface SubEntity
extends Renderable
    A sub entity is a renderable part of an entity, much like the independent pieces of a jigsaw puzzle forms a whole picture.

    A Sub-Entity is based on a single sub-mesh and a single material, i.e. there's a 1:1 relationship between them. This interface specifies the material to be applied separately from the sub-mesh to keep its geometric shape decoupled from its cosmetic appearance.

    Unlike their parent entities, sub-entities are renderable. Only renderable parts get submitted by the scene-manager to the render-system for processing.

    Sub-Entities are never created directly. Instead, they're created automatically when the SceneManager#createEntity(String, String) method is used to create an {@link Entity entity}.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera
    See Also:
    Entity, SubMesh
